summary: This bill, the "Safety Training for Officers on Public Health Threats Act" (STOP Health Threats Act), directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award grants to local governments. These grants are for training local law enforcement officers on public health threats stemming from building code violations. The bill outlines the requirements for grant applications, uses of funds (training programs, partnerships, coordination with relevant agencies), and prioritization of applicants based on training capacity and areas with identified threats. It provides a definition of enforcement officers.
